intro: Paracynoglossum yemenense, commonly known as the Yemen hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, demonstrating adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
